Processor.name: ATSAMD21G17D
Processor.description: Microchip ATSAMD21G17D device: Cortex-M0+ Microcontroller with 128KB Flash, 16KB SRAM, 48-pin package

Enum.name: EOC
Enum.description: Interrupt on end of comparison (single-shot mode only)

Enum.name: OFF
Enum.description: The output of COMPn is not routed to the COMPn I/O port

Enum.name: ASYNC
Enum.description: The asynchronous output of COMPn is routed to the COMPn I/O port

Enum.name: SYNC
Enum.description: The synchronous output (including filtering) of COMPn is routed to the COMPn I/O port

Enum.name: EOC
Enum.description: Interrupt on end of comparison (single-shot mode only)

Enum.name: OFF
Enum.description: The output of COMPn is not routed to the COMPn I/O port

Enum.name: ASYNC
Enum.description: The asynchronous output of COMPn is routed to the COMPn I/O port

Enum.name: SYNC
Enum.description: The synchronous output (including filtering) of COMPn is routed to the COMPn I/O port

BitField.name: SAMPLENUM
BitField.description: Number of Samples to be Collected

BitField.name: INPUTSCAN
BitField.description: Number of Input Channels Included in Scan

Enum.name: BLOCK
Enum.description: One trigger required for each block transfer

Enum.name: BEAT
Enum.description: One trigger required for each beat transfer

Enum.name: TRANSACTION
Enum.description: One trigger required for each transaction

Register.name: DMAC_CHINTFLAG
Register.description: Channel Interrupt Flag Status and Clear

BitField.name: JEPIDCL
BitField.description: Low part of the JEP-106 Identity Code

Register.name: EIC_NMIFLAG
Register.description: Non-Maskable Interrupt Flag Status and Clear

Enum.name: NO_EVT_OUTPUT
Enum.description: No event output when using the resynchronized or synchronous path

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE
Enum.description: Event detection only on the rising edge of the signal from the event generator when using the resynchronized or synchronous path

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE
Enum.description: Event detection only on the falling edge of the signal from the event generator when using the resynchronized or synchronous path

Enum.name: BOTH_EDGES
Enum.description: Event detection on rising and falling edges of the signal from the event generator when using the resynchronized or synchronous path

Enum.name: SLOT
Enum.description: Frame Sync Pulse is 1 Slot wide (default for I2S protocol)

Enum.name: HALF
Enum.description: Frame Sync Pulse is half a Frame wide

Enum.name: BIT
Enum.description: Frame Sync Pulse is 1 Bit wide

Enum.name: BURST
Enum.description: Clock Unit n operates in Burst mode, with a 1-bit wide Frame Sync pulse per Data sample, only when Data transfer is requested

Enum.name: SCKDIV
Enum.description: Divided Serial Clock n is used as Frame Sync n source

Enum.name: FSPIN
Enum.description: FSn input pin is used as Frame Sync n source

Enum.name: MCKDIV
Enum.description: Divided Master Clock n is used as Serial Clock n source

Enum.name: SCKPIN
Enum.description: SCKn input pin is used as Serial Clock n source

Enum.name: GCLK
Enum.description: GCLK_I2S_n is used as Master Clock n source

Enum.name: MCKPIN
Enum.description: MCKn input pin is used as Master Clock n source

Enum.name: PDM2
Enum.description: Receive one PDM data on each serial clock edge

BitField.name: TXDEFAULT
BitField.description: Line Default Line when Slot Disabled

Enum.name: HIZ
Enum.description: Output Default Value is high impedance

Enum.name: ZERO
Enum.description: Zero data transmitted in case of underrun

Enum.name: SAME
Enum.description: Last data transmitted in case of underrun

Enum.name: RIGHT
Enum.description: Data is right adjusted in slot

Enum.name: LEFT
Enum.description: Data is left adjusted in slot

Enum.name: RIGHT
Enum.description: Data is right adjusted in word

Enum.name: LEFT
Enum.description: Data is left adjusted in word

Enum.name: MSBIT
Enum.description: Transfer Data Most Significant Bit (MSB) first (default for I2S protocol)

Enum.name: LSBIT
Enum.description: Transfer Data Least Significant Bit (LSB) first

Enum.name: MONO
Enum.description: Left channel data is duplicated to right channel

Enum.name: MULTIPLE
Enum.description: One DMA channel per data channel

Enum.name: PDM2
Enum.description: Receive one PDM data on each serial clock edge

BitField.name: TXDEFAULT
BitField.description: Line Default Line when Slot Disabled

Enum.name: HIZ
Enum.description: Output Default Value is high impedance

Enum.name: ZERO
Enum.description: Zero data transmitted in case of underrun

Enum.name: SAME
Enum.description: Last data transmitted in case of underrun

Enum.name: RIGHT
Enum.description: Data is right adjusted in slot

Enum.name: LEFT
Enum.description: Data is left adjusted in slot

Enum.name: RIGHT
Enum.description: Data is right adjusted in word

Enum.name: LEFT
Enum.description: Data is left adjusted in word

Enum.name: MSBIT
Enum.description: Transfer Data Most Significant Bit (MSB) first (default for I2S protocol)

Enum.name: LSBIT
Enum.description: Transfer Data Least Significant Bit (LSB) first

Enum.name: MONO
Enum.description: Left channel data is duplicated to right channel

Enum.name: MULTIPLE
Enum.description: One DMA channel per data channel

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Maximum Value of the Trace Buffer in SRAM

Enum.name: ER
Enum.description: Erase Row - Erases the row addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: WP
Enum.description: Write Page - Writes the contents of the page buffer to the page addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: EAR
Enum.description: Erase Auxiliary Row - Erases the auxiliary row addressed by the ADDR register. This command can be given only when the security bit is not set and only to the user configuration row.

Enum.name: WAP
Enum.description: Write Auxiliary Page - Writes the contents of the page buffer to the page addressed by the ADDR register. This command can be given only when the security bit is not set and only to the user configuration row.

Enum.name: RWWEEER
Enum.description: RWW EEPROM area Erase Row - Erases the row addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: RWWEEWP
Enum.description: RWW EEPROM Write Page - Writes the contents of the page buffer to the page addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: LR
Enum.description: Lock Region - Locks the region containing the address location in the ADDR register.

Enum.name: UR
Enum.description: Unlock Region - Unlocks the region containing the address location in the ADDR register.

Enum.name: PBC
Enum.description: Page Buffer Clear - Clears the page buffer.

Enum.name: SSB
Enum.description: Set Security Bit - Sets the security bit by writing 0x00 to the first byte in the lockbit row.

Enum.name: WAKEONACCESS
Enum.description: NVM block enters low-power mode when entering sleep.NVM block exits low-power mode upon first access.

Enum.name: WAKEUPINSTANT
Enum.description: NVM block enters low-power mode when entering sleep.NVM block exits low-power mode when exiting sleep.

Enum.name: NO_MISS_PENALTY
Enum.description: The NVM Controller (cache system) does not insert wait states on a cache miss. Gives the best system performance.

Enum.name: LOW_POWER
Enum.description: Reduces power consumption of the cache system, but inserts a wait state each time there is a cache miss. This mode may not be relevant if CPU performance is required, as the application will be stalled and may lead to increase run time.

Enum.name: DETERMINISTIC
Enum.description: The cache system ensures that a cache hit or miss takes the same amount of time, determined by the number of programmed flash wait states. This mode can be used for real-time applications that require deterministic execution timings.

Enum.name: CPU
Enum.description: The CPU clock domain is stopped

Enum.name: AHB
Enum.description: The CPU and AHB clock domains are stopped

Enum.name: APB
Enum.description: The CPU, AHB and APB clock domains are stopped

BitField.name: PINMASK
BitField.description: Pin Mask for Multiple Pin Configuration

BitField.name: PINMASK
BitField.description: Pin Mask for Multiple Pin Configuration

BitField.name: PINMASK
BitField.description: Pin Mask for Multiple Pin Configuration

BitField.name: PINMASK
BitField.description: Pin Mask for Multiple Pin Configuration

Enum.name: HHMMSS
Enum.description: Match seconds, minutes, and hours only

Enum.name: DDHHMMSS
Enum.description: Match seconds, minutes, hours, and days only

Enum.name: MMDDHHMMSS
Enum.description: Match seconds, minutes, hours, days, and months only

Enum.name: YYMMDDHHMMSS
Enum.description: Match seconds, minutes, hours, days, months, and years

Enum.name: DITH4
Enum.description: Dithering is done every 16 PWM frames

Enum.name: DITH5
Enum.description: Dithering is done every 32 PWM frames

Enum.name: DITH6
Enum.description: Dithering is done every 64 PWM frames

Enum.name: GCLK
Enum.description: Reload or reset counter on next GCLK

Enum.name: PRESC
Enum.description: Reload or reset counter on next prescaler clock

Enum.name: RESYNC
Enum.description: Reload or reset counter on next GCLK and reset prescaler counter

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Command disabled: Index toggles between cycles A and B

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: Set index: cycle B will be forced in the next cycle

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Clear index: cycle A will be forced in the next cycle

Enum.name: HOLD
Enum.description: Hold index: the next cycle will be the same as the current cycle

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Force update of double buffered registers

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Command disabled: Index toggles between cycles A and B

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: Set index: cycle B will be forced in the next cycle

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Clear index: cycle A will be forced in the next cycle

Enum.name: HOLD
Enum.description: Hold index: the next cycle will be the same as the current cycle

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Force update of double buffered registers

Enum.name: ALTFAULT
Enum.description: Alternate fault (A or B) state at the end of the previous period

Enum.name: RISE
Enum.description: Blanking applied from rising edge of the output waveform

Enum.name: FALL
Enum.description: Blanking applied from falling edge of the output waveform

Enum.name: BOTH
Enum.description: Blanking applied from each toggle of the output waveform

Enum.name: ALTFAULT
Enum.description: Alternate fault (A or B) state at the end of the previous period

Enum.name: RISE
Enum.description: Blanking applied from rising edge of the output waveform

Enum.name: FALL
Enum.description: Blanking applied from falling edge of the output waveform

Enum.name: BOTH
Enum.description: Blanking applied from each toggle of the output waveform

BitField.name: FDDBD
BitField.description: Fault Detection on Debug Break Detection

Enum.name: RETRIGGER
Enum.description: Start, restart or re-trigger counter on event

Enum.name: COUNT
Enum.description: Count on active state of asynchronous event

Enum.name: PPW

Enum.name: START

Enum.description: An interrupt/event is generated when a counter cycle ends, except for the first and last cycles

Enum.name: BOUNDARY
Enum.description: An interrupt/event is generated when a new counter cycle starts or a counter cycle ends

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Command disabled: Index toggles between cycles A and B

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: Set index: cycle B will be forced in the next cycle

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Clear index: cycle A will be forced in the next cycle

Enum.name: HOLD
Enum.description: Hold index: the next cycle will be the same as the current cycle

Enum.description: Force update of double buffered registers

Enum.name: HSTM
Enum.description: HSTM: High Speed Test Mode (force high-speed mode for test mode)

Enum.name: NO
Enum.description: No handshake. LPM is not supported

Enum.name: OFF
Enum.description: OFF (L3). It corresponds to the powered-off, disconnected, and disabled state

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: ON (L0). It corresponds to the Idle and Active states

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Normal mode: the host starts in full-speed mode and performs a high-speed reset to switch to the high speed mode if the downstream peripheral is high-speed capable.

Enum.name: FS
Enum.description: Full-speed: the host remains in full-speed mode whatever is the peripheral speed capability. Relevant in UTMI mode only.

Register.name: USB_HOST.HSOFC
Register.description: HOST Host Start Of Frame Control

Enum.name: OFF
Enum.description: OFF (L3). It corresponds to the powered-off, disconnected, and disabled state

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: ON (L0). It corresponds to the Idle and Active states

BitField.name: HSOF
BitField.description: Host Start Of Frame Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: UPRSM
BitField.description: Upstream Resume from Device Interrupt Disable

BitField.description: Host Start Of Frame Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: DNRSM
BitField.description: DownStream to the Device Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: UPRSM
BitField.description: Upstream Resume fromthe device Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register
